results.adx_keywords: Kidnapping and Hostages;Salazar, Ken;Lopez Obrador, Andres Manuel;Matamoros (Mexico);Mexico;Brownsville (Tex)
results.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff, Maria Abi-Habib, Jack Nicas and Jacey Fortin
results.title: A Trip to Mexico Ends in a Kidnapping and the Deaths of 2 Americans
results.abstract: Four friends crossed the border on Friday, but within hours, they were abducted by gunmen and two of them were killed before the others were rescued Tuesday.

media.caption: The scene where gunmen kidnapped four U.S. citizens in Matamoros, Mexico.

results.adx_keywords: Pipelines;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);United States International Relations;Sabotage (Crime);United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Putin, Vladimir V;Scholz, Olaf (1958- );Zelensky, Volodymyr;Nord Stream AG;Baltic Sea;Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Adam Entous, Julian E. Barnes and Adam Goldman
results.title: Intelligence Suggests Pro-Ukrainian Group Sabotaged Pipelines, U.S. Officials Say
results.abstract: New intelligence reporting amounts to the first significant known lead about who was responsible for the attack on the Nord Stream pipelines that carried natural gas from Russia to Europe.

media.caption: The Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline in Lubmin, Germany, last year.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Legal Profession;Murdaugh, Randolph IV (Randy) (1966- );Murdaugh, Alex (1968- );Murdaugh, Margaret (d 2021);Murdaugh, Paul (d 2021);South Carolina
results.title: Breaking Silence, Murdaugh Brother Says ‘Not Knowing Is the Worst Thing’
results.abstract: After Alex Murdaugh’s trial ended in a conviction for the murders of his wife and son, his older brother Randy is still trying to understand what happened that night.

media.caption: “He knows more than what he’s saying,” Randy Murdaugh said of his brother, who was convicted of murder last week. “He’s not telling the truth, in my opinion, about everything there.”

results.adx_keywords: Intellectual Property;Industrial Espionage;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Computers and the Internet;Cyberwarfare and Defense;internal-sub-only;General Electric Company;China
results.title: The Daring Ruse That Exposed China’s Campaign to Steal American Secrets
results.abstract: How the downfall of one intelligence agent revealed the astonishing depth of Chinese industrial espionage.

results.adx_keywords: Television;News and News Media;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Voter Fraud (Election Fraud)
results.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and Katie Robertson
results.title: ‘The Whole Thing Seems Insane’: New Documents on Fox and the Election
results.abstract: Messages and depositions from stars like Tucker Carlson revealed serious misgivings about claims of fraud even as some hosts told millions of viewers a very different story.

media.caption: Fox News headquarters in New York. The latest release of documents in a defamation suit shed more light on the misgivings that many inside the network shared about claims of election fraud.

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Suits and Litigation (Civil);States (US);Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision);Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Pregnancy and Childbirth;Polls and Public Opinion;Paxton, Ken;Center for Reproductive Rights;Texas
results.title: Five Women Sue Texas Over the State’s Abortion Ban
results.abstract: The women, backed by an abortion-rights group, say they were denied abortions under state law despite risks to themselves and their fetuses that made the procedure a medical necessity.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

media.caption: Unable to obtain a selective abortion in Texas that was needed to save her own life and that of one of the twins she was carrying, Lauren Miller traveled to Colorado for the procedure. She is due to deliver the surviving twin later this month.
media.copyright: Nitashia Johnson for The New York Times

results.title: The Rumored ‘Vanderpump Rules’ Affair, Explained
results.abstract: Word of a cheating scandal involving the cast members of a Bravo reality television show has taken the internet by storm.

media.caption: Ariana Madix and Tom Sandoval are co-stars on Bravo TV’s reality show “Vanderpump Rules.”

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Draft and Recruitment (Military);Defense and Military Forces;Deaths (Fatalities);Content Type: Personal Profile;Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and Milana Mazaeva
results.title: He Heeded Russia’s Call to Enlist. Five Months Later, He Was Dead.
results.abstract: Pvt. Ivan Ovlashenko was one of at least 16,000 Russians who have died in Ukraine, more than in the Soviets’ Afghan war. It’s getting hard for the Kremlin to cover that up.

media.caption: Ivan Ovlashenko, who signed up to serve in the Russian military after receiving a mobilization summons last fall, in a photo provided by his family.

results.adx_keywords: Television
results.title: Jimmy Fallon Recaps Trump’s ‘Off the Rails’ CPAC Speech
results.abstract: Fallon said Donald Trump “made some pretty intense promises” in his headlining speech on Saturday.

media.caption: “He’s either running for president or auditioning to be the next John Wick,” Jimmy Fallon joked of Donald Trump on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Medicare;Health Insurance and Managed Care;Federal Budget (US);Inflation Reduction Act of 2022;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Margot Sanger-Katz
results.title: Biden Budget Will Propose Tax Increase to Bolster Medicare
results.abstract: The president’s plan targets Americans earning more than $400,000 a year in an attempt to increase the program’s solvency by 25 years.

media.caption: By focusing on Medicare in the budget and before its release, President Biden is seeking to sharpen a contrast with Republicans and cast himself as a protector of cherished retirement programs.

results.title: Joe Biden: My Plan to Extend Medicare for Another Generation
results.abstract: Medicare is the rock-solid guarantee that Americans count on. My budget will make the Medicare trust fund solvent beyond 2050.
des_facet: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

results.title: Ukraine Claims Bakhmut Battle Is Wagner’s ‘Last Stand’
results.abstract: Ukrainians say Russia’s Wagner mercenary group is running low on fighters recruited from prisons, used in attacks on Bakhmut, where Ukraine has also endured heavy losses.

media.caption: Servicemen from the 3rd Brigade mortar unit fire at Russian forces to support Ukrainian infantry near Bakhmut, on Tuesday.

results.title: How Judy Blume Finally Got a ‘Yes’ From Hollywood
results.abstract: Decades after she first discussed translating her work to film and television, the Blume-aissance is upon us. All it needed was for Judy Blume fans to take charge in the entertainment industry.

results.adx_keywords: Fish and Other Marine Life;Paleontology;Fossils;Research;your-feed-science;your-feed-animals;Diversity (Journal);Ohio River
results.title: Dunk Was Chunky, but Still Deadly
results.abstract: A fossil fish called Dunkleosteus was less svelte shark and more rotund tuna, but that only made it a fiercer predator in the seas of the Devonian Period.

media.caption: A Dunkleosteus terrelli skull on view at the Cleveland Museum of Natural History. Many Dunkleosteus fossils were found nearby in cliffs along the Rocky River.

results.adx_keywords: Immigration Detention;Immigration and Emigration;United States Politics and Government;Illegal Immigration;Asylum, Right of;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Homeland Security Department;Immigration and Customs Enforcement (US)
results.byline: By Eileen Sullivan and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
results.title: U.S. Is Said to Consider Reinstating Detention of Migrant Families
results.abstract: President Biden has turned to increasingly restrictive measures as his administration prepares for the end of Title 42, which has allowed border authorities to swiftly expel migrants.

media.caption: Women and children walking inside a detention center for families in Dilley, Texas, in 2019. The practice of detaining migrant families has been fiercely debated over the past four presidential administrations.
media.copyright: Ilana Panich-Linsman for The New York Times
